# UISearchContainerViewController

**Class**

A view controller that manages the presentation of search results in your interface.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor class UISearchContainerViewController
```

## Overview

In tvOS, rather than push a [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UISearchController] onto a navigation controller’s stack or use one as a child of another container view controller, embed an instance of this class and let it manage the presentation of the search controller’s content.

[doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UISearchContainerViewController] presents its [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UISearchController], instead of containing it. So implement view appearance methods, such as [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIViewController/viewWillAppear(_:)] and [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIViewController/didMove(toParent:)] on both view controllers.

## Creating a search container view controller

- **init(searchController:)**: Initializes and returns a search container view controller with the specified search controller object.

## Getting the search controller

- **searchController**: The search controller the search container view controller manages.

## Search interface

- **UISearchController**: A view controller that manages the display of search results based on interactions with a search bar.
- **UISearchBar**: A specialized view for receiving search-related information from the user.
- **UISearchResultsUpdating**: A set of methods that let you update search results based on information the user enters into the search bar.
- **Displaying searchable content by using a search controller**: Create a user interface with searchable content in a table view.
- **Using suggested searches with a search controller**: Create a search interface with a table view of suggested searches.
